name: Instagram Reel
primary_goal_vibe: High organic reach, rapid discovery, entertainment, and fast education through motion and sound.
tone_preference: Dynamic, direct, and visually driven. Human, fast-paced, and attention-first.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: The visual hook in the first 1–3 seconds is the primary driver of performance. The caption plays a secondary role and should provide context, reinforce the promise, and deliver a clear CTA. Use concise, value-led language.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1: reinforce the visual hook or promise. Lines 2–3: supporting context or clarification. Final line: strong CTA tied to interaction or follow behavior.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Very short to short. Brevity outperforms long-form captions for Reels.

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: On-screen text carries the main message and hook, not the caption.
best_practices: State the core promise in the first seconds

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: 5–10 relevant hashtags combining niche, topic, and community.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Prioritize relevance and intent over volume. Avoid trend hijacking if it is not contextually aligned.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag creators, collaborators, or featured accounts when they appear in the video.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 5–45 seconds for optimal retention, although longer is supported.
technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Keep critical text and subjects within the central vertical safe zone to avoid UI overlays.

required_elements: Strong visual hook in the first 1–3 seconds
Clear on-screen value statement or promise
Subtitles or on-screen text for sound-off viewing
disallowed_practices: Slow intros with no immediate value
Misalignment between visual hook and actual content
Reusing feed-style static copy without adaptation
